result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Oldenhoff was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fail/Maintain Sex Offender Registry, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 301.45(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: --The Court sentences Mr. Oldenhoff to 12 months to commence forthwith. The first six months are without Huber release, the last six months with Huber release privileges. The Sheriff is to calculate the counting of the subject months. This sentence is to commence forthwith.  The Court requires Mr. Oldenhoff to report and serve the jail term with absolute sobriety and with no non-prescribed controlled substances in his system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber Release privileges without further process.
--The Court orders payment of costs and surcharges [clerk's calculation of the total:  $518] within 90 days.  Non-payment will result in the entry of a civil judgment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew D. Oldenhoff

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 10:11am 
Defendant Matthew D. Oldenhoff in court, in custody.  ADA Jeffrey Shock in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
This hearing is scheduled on Mr. Oldenhoff's 10/6/22 letter.
Mr. Oldenhoff makes a statement in support of his request that the Court allow him to have Huber privileges after 4 1/2 months, and not after the 6 month designation given at sentencing.  
ADA Shock indicates that the State opposes Mr. Oldenhoff's request. 
The Court denies Mr. Oldenhoff's request; there will not be any adjustment to the Court's sentence.  
recess 10:14am
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bookkeeping response to 10/11/2022 LETC - Please complete the enclosed payment plan application and return to the Clerk of Courts office by 11/02/2022.  cc/def via JESO
Letter from defendant re payments
Letter from defendant re Huber
Huber

[MK] case called at briefly at 2:34pm, and then at 2:58pm
Defendant Matthew D. Oldenhoff in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa. ADA Michael Witt appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; element are recited; plea of " No Contest " entered; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

The Court sentences Mr. Oldenhoff to 12 months to commence forthwith. The first six months are without Huber release, the last six months with Huber release privileges. The Sheriff is to calculate the counting of the subject months. This sentence is to commence forthwith.  The Court requires Mr. Oldenhoff to report and serve the jail term with absolute sobriety and with no non-prescribed controlled substances in his system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber Release privileges without further process. 
The Court gives 52 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders payment of costs and surcharges [clerk's calculation of the total:  $518] within 90 days.  Non-payment will result in the entry of a civil judgment. 
recess 3:25pm
w/ ccs
Notice of Intent to Admit Statements Made By The Defendant
Motion to Impeach the Defendant with Prior Convictions

Final status/scheduling conference on August 2, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Jury trial on August 8, 2022 at 08:15 am.
made by the Defense on this date

MK] case called at 9:06am 
Defendant Matthew D. Oldenhoff in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Mr. Oldenhoff waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived; the charge and maximum penalties are recited
--plea of "not guilty" is entered
--the Defense demands a speedy trial.
recess 9:11am 

NEXT:   (1) FSSC on August 2nd at 2:30pm,  (2) Jury Trial on August 8th at 8:15am   (the Defendant remains in the JCJ  on the cash bail requirement)

[ma] Case called at 1:18pm 
Defendant Matthew D. Oldenhoff appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa (PD will appoint counsel).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies date of birth; provides address of: W1211 Lakeview Dr. Lot #3, Sullivan 53178
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court will schedule Preliminary Hearing within the time limit at request of Atty De La Rosa 

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $500 CASH bond, with condition:
--remain current, in contact, and in compliance with Sex Offender Registry
recess 1:28 pm. 

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 6/30/22 at 8:30am (within time limits)
